metadata.title: Static Electricity
metadata.subject: Science
metadata.description: This chapter introduces the concept of static electricity, electric charge, and how it is generated.

concepts.title: Electric Charge
concepts.content: Electric charge is the physical property of matter that causes it to experience a force when placed in an electromagnetic field. There are two types of electric charges: positive and negative. Like charges repel each other, and opposite charges attract each other.

examples.text: Rubbing a glass rod with silk cloth makes the rod positively charged.
Rubbing an ebonite rod with fur makes the rod negatively charged.

keyPoints.text: The SI unit of electric charge is the Coulomb (C).
An object with an equal amount of positive and negative charge is electrically neutral.

concepts.funFact: The study of static electricity is called electrostatics.

concepts.title: Frictional Electricity
concepts.content: Frictional electricity is the electricity produced by rubbing two suitable bodies together. This is because of the transfer of electrons from one body to another.

examples.text: Combing dry hair makes the comb charged, which can then attract small pieces of paper.
Walking on a carpet and then touching a doorknob can cause a small electric shock.

keyPoints.text: The body that loses electrons becomes positively charged.
The body that gains electrons becomes negatively charged.

concepts.funFact: The ancient Greeks discovered static electricity when they rubbed amber with fur.

concepts.title: Lightning
concepts.content: Lightning is a large-scale electrostatic discharge between electrically charged regions within clouds, or between a cloud and the Earth's surface. A lightning conductor is a device used to protect buildings from the damage caused by lightning.

examples.text: A lightning strike during a thunderstorm.
A lightning conductor on top of a tall building providing a safe path for the lightning to the ground.

keyPoints.text: Lightning is a powerful and dangerous form of static electricity.
It is important to take safety precautions during a thunderstorm.

concepts.funFact: A single bolt of lightning can contain up to one billion volts of electricity!

test.question: What will happen if you bring a positively charged rod near a negatively charged rod?
options: They will both lose their charge

test.question: How is static electricity generated?
options: By passing a current through an object
test.explanation: Static electricity is generated by the transfer of electrons when two objects are rubbed together.

test.question: What is the purpose of a lightning conductor?
options: To provide a safe path for lightning to the ground
test.explanation: A lightning conductor protects buildings by providing a safe path for the lightning to the ground.

test.question: An object becomes positively charged when it ________ electrons.
test.explanation: When an object loses electrons (which are negatively charged), it has more protons (positively charged) and becomes positively charged.

test.question: Which of these is a good conductor of electricity?
test.explanation: Copper is a metal and a good conductor of electricity.

test.question: Why do you sometimes get a shock when you touch a doorknob after walking on a carpet?
options: You have built up static electricity
test.explanation: Walking on a carpet can build up static electricity in your body, which is discharged when you touch a metal doorknob.

test.question: A gold-leaf electroscope is used to ________.
test.explanation: A gold-leaf electroscope is an instrument used for detecting the presence of an electric charge on a body.

test.question: When you rub a comb on dry hair, the comb gets charged due to the transfer of ________.
test.explanation: The charge is generated due to the transfer of electrons from the hair to the comb.

commonMisconceptions: Static electricity is a different kind of electricity than the one in our homes.
All materials can be easily charged by friction.
realWorldExamples: A balloon sticking to a wall
Getting a shock from a doorknob
